motivation.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
motivation.author: Steve Jobs

motivation.text: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
motivation.author: Steve Jobs

motivation.text: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
motivation.author: John Lennon

motivation.text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
motivation.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

motivation.text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
motivation.author: Aristotle

motivation.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
motivation.author: Winston Churchill

coding.text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
coding.author: John Johnson

coding.text: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad.
coding.author: Cory House

coding.text: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
coding.author: Harold Abelson

coding.text: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
coding.author: Thomas Fuchs

coding.text: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
coding.author: Martin Fowler

coding.text: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
coding.author: Oscar Wilde

coding.text: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.
coding.author: C.A.R. Hoare

learning.text: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
learning.author: Mahatma Gandhi

learning.text: The beautiful thing about learning is that nobody can take it away from you.
learning.author: B.B. King

learning.text: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
learning.author: Nelson Mandela

learning.text: The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go.
learning.author: Dr. Seuss

learning.text: The expert in anything was once a beginner.
learning.author: Helen Hayes

learning.text: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
learning.author: Pablo Picasso

learning.text: Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.
learning.author: Benjamin Franklin
